rum.title: Real User Monitoring
rum.aboutRUMTitle: Discover Real User Monitoring to Enhance Your User Experience
rum.aboutRUMMessage: Real User Monitoring allows you to track and analyze the performance of your website or application from the perspective of real users. This means understanding how actual users experience your site, where they face slowdowns, which pages they frequently use, and more.
rum.getStartedTitle: Get Started with Real User Monitoring

about.name: OpenObserve
about.os_libraries_msg: Built on the shoulders of giants. OpenObserve depends on many amazing open source libraries.

about.feature_comparision_good_news: Good news: OpenObserve Enterprise Edition is completely free for up to 200 GB/day (~6 TB/month) of data ingestion.

dashboard.trellisTooltip: This is only applicable when breakdown field is available. Add Breakdown Field to enable Trellis Layout
dashboard.trellisTimeShiftTooltip: Trellis is not supported for Time Shift Comparison (Comparison Against). Please remove Time Shift Comparison to enable Trellis Layout
dashboard.stepValueTooltip: The interval between datapoints, which must be returned from the range query.
dashboard.groupMultiYAxisTrellisTooltipEnabled: Enabled: Groups all Y-axis metrics for the same breakdown value into a single trellis chart
dashboard.groupMultiYAxisTrellisTooltipDisabled: Disabled: Creates separate trellis charts for each Y-axis metric and breakdown value combination
dashboard.groupMultiYAxisTrellisTooltipExample: Example: With Y-axis fields [CPU, Memory] and breakdown by [Server A, Server B]:
dashboard.groupMultiYAxisTrellisTooltipEnabledResu: • Enabled: 2 charts (Server A chart with CPU+Memory, Server B chart with CPU+Memory)
dashboard.groupMultiYAxisTrellisTooltipDisabledRes: • Disabled: 4 charts (Server A CPU, Server A Memory, Server B CPU, Server B Memory)
dashboard.groupMultiYAxisTrellisTooltipDescription: When you have multiple Y-axis fields and a breakdown field:
dashboard.topNTooltipTitle: This is only applicable when breakdown field is available
dashboard.topNTooltipDescription: Specify the number of Top N values to show when breakdown field is available.
dashboard.addOthersSeriesTooltip: Include an 'others' series for values outside the top results when using breakdown fields.
dashboard.noValueReplacementTooltip: What to display when a value is missing for time series
dashboard.yAxisMinTooltipTitle: Set the minimum value for the Y-axis.
dashboard.yAxisMinTooltipDescription: This defines the lowest point to display on the chart, but the axis may adjust lower if the data includes smaller values.
dashboard.yAxisMaxTooltipTitle: Set the maximum value for the Y-axis.
dashboard.yAxisMaxTooltipDescription: This defines the highest point to display on the chart, but the axis may adjust higher if the data includes larger values.
dashboard.comparisonAgainstTooltip: This feature allows you to compare data points from multiple queries over a selected time range. By adjusting the date or time, the system will retrieve corresponding data from different queries, enabling you to observe changes or differences between the selected time periods.
dashboard.markLinesTooltip: Show threshold lines on the chart.
dashboard.colorDefaultPaletteBySeriesSubLabel: Series with the same name will use the same color
dashboard.colorPaletteClassicSubLabel: A random color will be used for each series, regardless of its name
dashboard.colorSingleColorSubLabel: Set a specific color to all series
dashboard.drilldownTooltip: Navigate to a another dashboard or specified URL, carrying over all current variables for seamless data exploration.
dashboard.colorBySeriesTooltip: Apply colors to series for better visual distinction in charts. Customize colors for each series to enhance data visualization.

deduplication.title: Alert Deduplication
deduplication.subtitle: Prevent duplicate alerts by configuring fingerprint-based deduplication.
deduplication.fingerprintFieldsHint: Select fields to use for deduplication. Leave empty for auto-detection based on query type.
deduplication.fingerprintFieldsTooltip: Fields used to create unique fingerprints for alert deduplication. Fingerprints include alert name + metric/condition + selected fields, ensuring different alert types (e.g., High CPU vs High Memory) are never deduplicated together, even if they monitor the same entities. Leave empty for auto-detection: SQL queries use WHERE clause columns + GROUP BY columns, PromQL uses metric name + label dimensions, Custom queries use condition fields.
deduplication.timeWindowHint: How long to track alert fingerprints. Leave empty to use alert period.
deduplication.timeWindowTooltip: Duration to track and deduplicate alert fingerprints. If an alert with the same fingerprint occurs within this window, it will be suppressed. Leave empty to use the alert evaluation period.
deduplication.maxGroupSizeTooltip: Maximum number of deduplicated alerts to group together before sending a notification. Prevents overwhelming notifications when many similar alerts fire simultaneously.
deduplication.sendStrategyTooltip:
How to send grouped alerts:
• First with count: Send first alert with total count
• Summary: Send aggregated summary
• All: Send all alerts in one notification
deduplication.groupWaitTimeTooltip: Time to wait and collect similar alerts before sending a grouped notification. Allows batching of alerts that occur in quick succession.

correlation.title: Correlation Settings
correlation.subtitle: Discover and manage service correlations across logs, traces, and metrics
correlation.discoveredServicesDescription: Services are automatically discovered from your telemetry data and grouped by their Fully Qualified Name (FQN) for correlation. Services sharing the same FQN are correlated together across logs, traces, and metrics.
correlation.noServicesDescription: Services will appear here as telemetry data is ingested with service identification attributes (like k8s-deployment, service name, etc.)
correlation.clickToViewSuggestions: Click to view correlation improvement suggestions
correlation.noSharedDimensions: No shared dimensions found across services
correlation.suggestionsDialogSubtitle: Services that could be correlated but are missing telemetry types
correlation.suggestionsInfoText: To enable full correlation, ensure your telemetry data includes consistent service identification attributes (like k8s-deployment, service name) across logs, traces, and metrics.
correlation.addTracingSuggestion: Add OpenTelemetry tracing instrumentation to enable full correlation
correlation.addLogsSuggestion: Configure log collection with matching service attributes
correlation.addMetricsSuggestion: Add metrics collection with matching service dimensions
correlation.serviceIdentityDescription: Configure how services are identified and correlated across logs, traces, and metrics. The Service FQN (Fully Qualified Name) is derived from workload dimensions in priority order.
correlation.howItWorksDescription: (Fully Qualified Name) is computed from your telemetry dimensions to uniquely identify and correlate services across different data sources.
correlation.priorityOrderDescription: Dimensions are checked in the order listed below. The first dimension with a value becomes the Service FQN.
correlation.exampleText: If you have both {dim1} and {dim2}, the FQN will be {value} because k8s-deployment has higher priority.
correlation.correlationDescription: Services with the same FQN are correlated, even if they have different {field} names.
correlation.fqnPriorityTooltip: Defines which dimensions are used to derive the Service FQN for correlation. First dimension with a value wins. Reorder to match your infrastructure.
correlation.fqnPriorityDescription: Drag to reorder or use arrow buttons. First matching dimension determines Service FQN.
correlation.noDimensionsConfigured: No dimensions configured. Click "Reset to Defaults" or add dimensions below.
correlation.addDimensionHint: Select a semantic group, then choose a field to add to the priority list.
correlation.allFieldsAdded: All fields from this group are already added
correlation.noSemanticGroupsAvailable: No semantic groups available. Configure field mappings below first.
correlation.noSemanticGroupsConfigured: No semantic groups configured. Add field mappings below to define available dimensions.
correlation.configureSemanticGroupsFirst: Configure semantic field mappings below to define available dimensions for FQN priority.
correlation.semanticFieldTooltip: Maps different field names to semantic dimensions. For example, "deployment", "k8s.deployment.name", and "kube_deployment" all map to "k8s-deployment".
correlation.semanticFieldDescription: Configure how field names from your telemetry are mapped to semantic dimensions.
